artist: Artist: José Guadalupe Posada; Publisher: La Estampa Mexicana, Mexico; Printer: Taller de Grafica Popular, Mexico City
creditline: Gift of Lisa and David Erickson
description: two women and three men, with three of the figures holding rounded objects in the air (paddles?) funning in front of a huge dark-skinned head with flames extending from its mouth; mouth has fangs; women in foreground wear skirts, aprons, white stockings and hats with feathers; three men wear knickers, tunics and white stockings--one man seen from back wears a cape; text at top and bottom: "EL TESTERAZO DEL DIABLO / JUGUETTE PASTORIL / EN UN AGYO / EDICION / DE / A. VANEGAS / ARROYO / MEXICO"
portfolio: From 25 Prints of Jose Guadalupe Posada
provenance: Lisa and David Erickson, Minneapolis; given to Mia, 2017
title: El Testarazo del Diablo (Testing the Devil), plate 8 from "25 Prints of Jose Guadalupe Posada"
